conclusion: The straight line a represents the power source and the curve b represents the small light bulb.
The intersection point of line a and curve b provides the operating point of the circuit.
The output power of the power source is given by the voltage across the load multiplied by the current through the load.
At the intersection point: U = 2V, I = 2A, so P_out = U x I = 2V x 2A = 4W.
The total power of the power source is given by the voltage of the power source multiplied by the total current.
The voltage of the power source is the open-circuit voltage, which is 3V from the graph.
The total current is the same as the current through the load (2A).
The output power of the power source is 4W and the total power of the power source is 6W.
